title: A Pilot Study for the Healthy Actions and Lifestyles to Avoid Dementia or Hispanos y el ALTo a la Demencia Program (HALT-AD)
description_brief:
A Pilot Study for the Healthy Actions and Lifestyles to Avoid Dementia or Hispanos y el ALTo a la Demencia program (HALT-AD). This initial four-months pilot study will focus on at least three educational courses (introduction to dementia and lifestyle risk factors, sleep and diet). It may also include a fourth educational course on social connectivity and loneliness. Completion of this initial pilot study will allow for a round of improvements informed by data from the program, on usability, as well as feedback from participants and citizen advisors. This will allow for an iterative process to build the program to its full content, with feedback to optimize the user experience and ensure the accessibility of the content. The information generated from this study will help inform the development of the second program's prototype, expected to benefit from the initial pilot to become more user-friendly, effective and accessible to the target audience.

This pilot study will be a longitudinal study of an inception cohort exposed to the HALT-AD online educational program for a four-month study. It will utilize pre- and post- intervention collection of quantitative and qualitative data to evaluate the program's first prototype.
description_detailed:
Healthy Actions and Lifestyles to Avoid Dementia or Hispanos y el ALTo a la Demencia program (HALT- AD) is a novel bilingual educational program that will focus on reducing risk factors with the ultimate goal of preventing dementia. It will be centered around a web-based interactive virtual online platform that will be developed to be dynamic, engaging, and interactive. Through interactive courses, the educational content of HALT-AD will provide guidance on modifiable lifestyle risk factors and the identification of treatable medical conditions including cerebrovascular health, sleep, sensory loss, social isolation, mood, diet, and physical activity.

Participants in HALT-AD will be provided with personalized risk profiles, will be encouraged to learn about risk factors and how they can effectively modify them, and will be provided with feedback on their progress. Participants will participate in facilitated support discussion groups, which will focus on the content of the educational material and the invocation of change through participant engagement and compliance.

Prior to launching the full HALT-AD program, it is essential that the Sponsor conduct a preliminary pilot study to evaluate the program's first prototype. At the end of the 3-month pilot program, evaluations will include: the usability of- and engagement with- the online platform and users' acceptability of the learning content and facilitated support discussion groups. As well as evaluating preliminary evidence on the effectiveness of the program in changing knowledge, self-efficacy, and dementia-related lifestyle risk factors. The program will also be evaluated on metrics such as being user friendly, engaging, supportive and communicative, with the potential for scalability to state- and national-levels.

Aims:

1. To evaluate engagement with- the online platform
2. To evaluate preliminary evidence on the effectiveness of the program in changing

   a) knowledge, b) self-efficacy, and c) dementia-related lifestyle risk factors
3. To determine users' acceptability of the program content
4. To determine users' acceptability and satisfaction with the facilitated support discussion groups
5. To evaluate the usability of the online platform

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Cognitively normal midlife and older-adult participants were eligible to participate in this single arm pilot study. A total of 20 participants were enrolled at University of California San Diego. Recruitment began in March 2022 and the last participant exited the study August 2022. One participant withdrew from the study early.

groups.title: HALT-AD
groups.description: HALT-AD is an online educational program designed to teach about dementia and lifestyle changes that can help preserve brain health and lower dementia risk. Participants complete online courses and engage in facilitated discussion groups.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Knowledge on the HALT-AD Knowledge Assessment Survey at 4 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: The HALT-AD knowledge assessment survey is developed based on the HALT-AD program content to assess general knowledge of dementia including risk factors, brain health and prevention. Possible scores range from 0 (all answers are incorrect) to 20 (all answers are correct), with higher scores indicating greater knowledge of dementia. Change = (4 months score - baseline score). The greater the change in score, the greater the increase in knowledge of dementia.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 14 out of 19 participants had completed the HALT-AD knowledge assessment survey at the end of the study

groups.title: HALT-AD
groups.description: HALT-AD is an online educational program designed to teach about dementia and lifestyle changes that can help preserve brain health and lower dementia risk. Participants complete online courses and engage in facilitated discussion groups.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Self-efficacy on the New General Self-Efficacy Scale (NGSE) at 4 Months.
outcomeMeasures.description: The NGSE is an 8-item validated instrument assessing self-efficacy. Using a 5-point rating scale (1= strongly disagree to 5= strongly agree), participants report how much they believe they can achieve their goals. Total score for each participant is calculated by taking the mean of their ratings on each item, with the total possible score ranging from 1 to 5 and higher scores indicating greater self-efficacy. Change = (4 months score - baseline score). The greater the change in score, the greater the increase in self-efficacy.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 14 out of 19 participants had completed the HALT-AD New General Self-Efficacy Scale (NGSE) survey at the end of the study

groups.title: HALT-AD
groups.description: HALT-AD is an online educational program designed to teach about dementia and lifestyle changes that can help preserve brain health and lower dementia risk. Participants complete online courses and engage in facilitated discussion groups.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Lifestyle Risk on the HALT-AD Lifestyle Risk Assessment Survey at 4 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: The HALT-AD lifestyle risk assessment survey is developed by the HALT-AD subject- matter expert team to assess adherence to a potentially dementia risk-reducing lifestyle. Possible scores range from 3 (very high risk) to 15 (very low risk). Change = (4 months total score - baseline total score). The greater the change in score, the greater the increase in adherence to a potentially dementia risk-reducing lifestyle.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 14 out of 19 participants completed the HALT-AD lifestyle risk assessment survey at the end of the study

groups.title: HALT-AD

outcomeMeasures.title: Acceptability Survey- Users' Acceptability of the HALT-AD Program Content
outcomeMeasures.description: Qualitative evaluation of participant responses on the HALT-AD Course Acceptability Survey completed at 4 months

outcomeMeasures.title: FOCUS Group Discussion- Qualitative Evaluation of the HALT-AD Program Content
outcomeMeasures.description: Qualitative evaluation of participant responses during the focus group discussion

outcomeMeasures.title: Users' Satisfaction With the Facilitated Support Discussion Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: Qualitative evaluation of participant responses on the HALT-AD Facilitated Discussion Group Acceptability Survey

outcomeMeasures.title: Qualitative Evaluation of Participant Responses During the Focus Group Discussion Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: Qualitative evaluation of participant responses during the focus group-discussion groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Usability of the HALT-AD Program
outcomeMeasures.description: Users will complete the HALT-AD User Experience survey which is adapted for HALT-AD based on questions from the User Experience Questionnaire (UEQ) available at https://ueqtryitout.ueq-research.org/. Participants will be asked to decide as spontaneously as possible which conflicting terms (e.g. annoying vs. enjoyable) better describes the HALT-AD program. Additionally, users will complete the Net Promoter Score Survey (NPS) which asks one question "How likely is it that you would recommend HALT-AD to a friend or colleague?" and is reported on a scale of -100 (extremely unlikely) to +100 (extremely likely).

eventGroups.title: HALT-AD
eventGroups.description: HALT-AD is an online educational program designed to teach about dementia and lifestyle changes that can help preserve brain health and lower dementia risk. Participants complete online courses and engage in facilitated discussion groups.

explanation_target: Reason: The described intervention is an online, bilingual educational/behavioral program (HALT-AD) that delivers modules on dementia and modifiable lifestyle risk factors (e.g., sleep, diet, social connectivity) to increase knowledge, self-efficacy and promote behavior change — not a drug, biologic, or device. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Act: Key extracted details — pilot, four-month longitudinal prototype test; at least three educational courses (introduction to dementia and lifestyle risk factors, sleep, diet), optional fourth on social connectivity; pre- and post-intervention quantitative and qualitative evaluation of usability, knowledge, self-efficacy and lifestyle risk. No pharmacologic agent, monoclonal antibody, vaccine, small molecule, or cognitive-enhancing drug is mentioned. citeturn0search1turn0search2

Reflect: Classification check — by definitions: (1) disease-targeted biologic = biologics targeting pathology (e.g., anti-amyloid antibodies) — not present; (2) disease-targeted small molecule = pharmacologic agents targeting pathology — not present; (3) cognitive enhancer = drug to improve cognition without targeting pathology — not present; (4) neuropsychiatric symptom improvement = treatment for behavioral/psychiatric symptoms — not the focus. The HALT-AD program is an educational/behavioral risk-reduction intervention and therefore does not fit any of the four therapeutic categories; final classification = 'N/A'. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Web search results supporting this classification: (a) 'Developing the Healthy Actions and Lifestyles to Avoid Dementia or Hispanos y el ALTo a la Demencia program' (Wiley / Alzheimer’s & Dementia: Translational Research & Clinical Interventions) — detailed description of HALT-AD program and pilot methods. citeturn0search0 (b) PubMed entry/abstract summarizing HALT-AD development and pilot-testing approach. citeturn0search1 (c) ADCS HALT-AD Study page summarizing the bilingual online personalized platform. citeturn0search3 (d) Trial listing (MedPath) with outcome measures (knowledge, self-efficacy, lifestyle risk) and trial logistics. citeturn0search2
